AVSEC Order No. 06/2018

Subject: Aerodrome Security Programme

In exercise of powers conferred by Section 5A of the Aircraft Act, 1934 (XXII of 1934),
read with rule 3 (b) of the Aircraft (Security) Rules, 2011, Director General, Bureau of Civil
Aviation Security (DG, BCAS), for the purpose of safety of passengers, crew, ground personnel
and the general public in all matters related to safeguarding against acts of unlawful interference
with civil aviation, directs that the Aerodrome Security Programme (ASP) which has been
reviewed and updated to comply with the Standards of Annex-17 and security related provisions
of Annex-9 to the Convention on International Civil Aviation, shall be implemented by all agencies
connected with civil aviation security in India. The revised model template is available on the
BCAS restricted site

2. In terms of rule 8 of the Aircraft (Security) Rules, 201 1, every aerodrome operator shall,
with the approval of DG, BCAS, make and comply with the ASP in accordance with the NCASP
and any amendment to such programme shall be made only after the approval of DG, BCAS. No
aerodrome operator shall be allowed to commence civil aviation operations from an airport in India
unless the ASP of that aerodrome has been approved by the DG, BCAS.

3. The ASP shall be valid for a period of five (05) years and it shall be updated in accordance
with the security directions issued by the DG, BCAS from time to time. After expiry, a revised
ASP in respect of the airport shall be submitted for the approval of the DG, BCAS.

4, This supersedes ASP issued vide AVSEC Circular No. 12/2006 dated 26/07/2006 and its
corrigendum dated 17/01/2011,

5. Any violation of this AVSEC Order shall attract penalty under Section 11 A of the Aircraft
Act 1934.
